Course Section: EOSC_V 114-99C - The Catastrophic Earth: Natural Disasters
Course Section Definition Public Notes: EOSC 114 is a hybrid, asynchronous course for all students. Â All course content is available directly on the course website or through links to outside resources. There is no textbook for this course. All Quizzes and Assignments are open over a set number of days for students to complete when it fits best within their own schedule. These are then submitted online, through the Course Website. There are no lectures to attend or video lectures to follow. The only time students need to attend a session in-person is for the written final exam. The final exam will be written during the UBC exam period, at a time and date arranged by UBC Exam Services. All students will attend the final exam in-person in a UBC classroom.

Course Section: EXCH_V 101-201 - Canadian University Study Abroad Program (CUSAP) Exchange

Course Section Definition Public Notes: If this section if FULL or BLOCKED please sign up for the corresponding waitlist section. Once you have registered in the wait list there is no need to contact the department. Your registration will be switched to the parent section when space becomes available. Preference may be given to Majors, Minors, or Honours students in Theatre or Film. For more information about Department of Theatre and Film wait lists please visit: http://theatrefilm.ubc.ca/undergraduate/undergraduate-courses/how-to-wait-list-a-course/Â

Course Section: FNEL_V 102-A_001 - Introduction to a Salish Language II (A)
Course Section Definition Public Notes: Continued focus on the diverse range of language learning skills that advance competency in conversational fluency, pronunciation, comprehension, vocabulary, oral traditions, literacy, grammatical understanding, and the cultural contextualization of language use. Prerequisite: FNEL 101. For students interested in this course, please register on the waitlist. We will be conducting a pre-req check and moving students that meet the requirements. The location of the class is on the Musqueam Reserve at the Musqueam Community Center, 6735 Salish Drive, Vancouver, B.C.

Follow the prompts to register in all stream seminars (1), lectures (2), and tutorials (1-2) each term.Â
